block.p: Laura Emily Kresch, the daughter of Sheila and Robert Kresch of White Plains, is to be married today to Charles Christopher Curran III, a son of Dianne Curran of Bothell, Wash., and Mr. Curran Jr. of Seattle. Rabbi Ari Fridkis is to perform the ceremony at Tappan Hill in Tarrytown, N.Y.

The bride, 29, graduated cum laude from Yale University and is a candidate for a Ph.D. in epidemiology at Johns Hopkins University. She was until June a researcher in pediatric immunology at the National Institute of Child Health and Human Development in Rockville, Md. Her father is a partner in Biederman, Greenwald, Kresch & Gerbasi, an accounting firm in New York. Her mother is the director of intake and outreach at Job Path, a social services organization in New York for people with disabilities.

Laura Emily Kresch, the daughter of Sheila and Robert Kresch of White Plains, is to be married today to Charles Christopher Curran III, a son of Dianne Curran of Bothell, Wash., and Mr. Curran Jr. of Seattle. Rabbi Ari Fridkis is to perform the ceremony at Tappan Hill in Tarrytown, N.Y.

The bride, 29, graduated cum laude from Yale University and is a candidate for a Ph.D. in epidemiology at Johns Hopkins University. She was until June a researcher in pediatric immunology at the National Institute of Child Health and Human Development in Rockville, Md. Her father is a partner in Biederman, Greenwald, Kresch & Gerbasi, an accounting firm in New York. Her mother is the director of intake and outreach at Job Path, a social services organization in New York for people with disabilities.

The bridegroom, 26, graduated with distinction from Stanford University and is a candidate for an M.B.A. at Harvard University. His mother runs Educare, an educational testing and consulting concern in Kirkland, Wash. His father, who is retired, ran three commodities funds in Bellevue, Wash., for Geldermann Inc., a former Chicago brokerage firm. The bridegroom is a stepson of Junia Curran.
